message:
SYSTEM: Wiki: https://delicias.dia.fi.upm.es/wiki/index.php/Carlos%27_Tasks/DEXA2010paper 

DEXA 2010 paper

Evaluation

Experiment description

In this experiment we show how the distribution across different SPARQL enpoints happens. The configuration of the system is a Pentium Core 2 duo, T9300 @ 2.5 GHz, 3GB RAM. The vase query can be found
here
We considered the following SPARQL Endpoints:
iproclass
Taxon
GenBank
GeneId
The purpose of this evaluation is to show how queries are distributed and optimised using basic SQL optimisers. We build several queries, connecting to several endpoints, each query connecting to one more. We also increase the complexity of the query adding OPTIONAL patterns to prove the validity of the SQL operators.
Query to 2 SPARQL Endpoints
Query to 2 SPARQL Endpoints with optimisers
Query to 2 SPARQL Endpoints with optional
Query to 2 SPARQL Endpoints with optional and optimisers
This query asks for the gene id related to the protein
http://bio2rdf.org/iproclass:Q8KKD2
and its name in the taxonomy used by the bio2rdf project.
SPARQLquery =
        	"SELECT ?geneid.gene ?iproclass.gene ?taxon.x ?genbank.genBank " +
        	" FROM iproclass: <http://iproclass.bio2rdf.org/sparql> " +
			" FROM geneid: <http://geneid.bio2rdf.org/sparql> " +
        	" FROM taxon: <http://localhost:2020/sparql-taxon> " +
        	" FROM genbank: <http://castor.dia.fi.upm.es:2020/sparql-genebank> " +
        	" WHERE" +
        	" {" +
        	" 	<http://bio2rdf.org/iproclass:Q8KKD2> <http://bio2rdf.org/ns/iproclass#xGeneid> ?iproclass.gene ." +
			"	?geneid.gene  <http://bio2rdf.org/ns/bio2rdf#xTaxon> ?geneid.taxon . " +
        	"}";
Query to 3 SPARQL Endpoints
Query to 3 SPARQL Endpoints with optimisers
Query to 3 SPARQL Endpoints with optional
Query to 3 SPARQL Endpoints with optional and optimisers
This query asks for the gene id related to the protein
http://bio2rdf.org/iproclass:Q8KKD2
and its name in the taxonomy used by the bio2rdf project. It also queries for the gene that it codifies this taxonomy,
SPARQLquery =
        	"SELECT ?geneid.gene ?iproclass.gene ?taxon.x ?genbank.genBank " +
        	" FROM iproclass: <http://iproclass.bio2rdf.org/sparql> " +
			" FROM geneid: <http://geneid.bio2rdf.org/sparql> " +
        	" FROM taxon: <http://localhost:2020/sparql-taxon> " +
        	" FROM genbank: <http://castor.dia.fi.upm.es:2020/sparql-genebank> " +
        	" WHERE" +
        	" {" +
        	" 	<http://bio2rdf.org/iproclass:Q8KKD2> <http://bio2rdf.org/ns/iproclass#xGeneid> ?iproclass.gene ." +
			"	?geneid.gene  <http://bio2rdf.org/ns/bio2rdf#xTaxon> ?geneid.taxon . " +
			"	?taxon.taxon <http://bio2rdf.org/ontology/bio2rdf:xGI> ?taxon.x . " +
        	"}";
Query to 4 SPARQL Endpoints
Query to 4 SPARQL Endpoints with optimisers
Query to 4 SPARQL Endpoints with optional
Query to 4 SPARQL Endpoints with optional and optimisers
Finally this query connects to the gene bank SPARQL endpoint and asks for the gen related to the taxonomy
SPARQLquery =
        	"SELECT ?geneid.gene ?iproclass.gene ?taxon.x ?genbank.genBank " +
        	" FROM iproclass: <http://iproclass.bio2rdf.org/sparql> " +
		" FROM geneid: <http://geneid.bio2rdf.org/sparql> " +
        	" FROM taxon: <http://localhost:2020/sparql-taxon> " +
        	" FROM genbank: <http://castor.dia.fi.upm.es:2020/sparql-genebank> " +
        	" WHERE" +
        	" {" +
        	" 	<http://bio2rdf.org/iproclass:Q8KKD2> <http://bio2rdf.org/ns/iproclass#xGeneid> ?iproclass.gene ." +
		"	?geneid.gene  <http://bio2rdf.org/ns/bio2rdf#xTaxon> ?geneid.taxon . " +
		"	?taxon.taxon <http://bio2rdf.org/ontology/bio2rdf:xGI> ?taxon.x . " +
        	" 	?genbank.x  <http://bio2rdf.org/ontology/ncbi:featureID> ?genbank.genBank . " +
        	"}";
In these comparisons participare three systems: SparqlDQP, DARQ and NetworkedGraphs. Each triple pattren connects to one different SPARQL endpoint, so in the end we have that each triple pattern must do a join with the next one. The data in each triple pattern comes from one endpoint.
Maybe it will be interesting to add more triple patterns inside the OPTIONAL clause and see how it is evaluated. This is proff for SparqlDQP robustness.
The queries with OPTIONAL would look like the last one, but adding new optional clause, and generating new queries plans. It can be shown how the LQPs are generated and their differences, proving the initial assumptions in the paper, SQL and SPARQL compatibility (eventhough this has been proven elsewhere), the distribution (which has also been proven elsewhere) and the optimisation (which is proven here). I think that all these three assumtions have not been proven together, which is why this paper exists. What do you think?
SPARQLquery =
        	"SELECT ?geneid.gene ?iproclass.gene ?taxon.x ?genbank.genBank " +
        	" FROM iproclass: <http://iproclass.bio2rdf.org/sparql> " +
		" FROM geneid: <http://geneid.bio2rdf.org/sparql> " +
        	" FROM taxon: <http://localhost:2020/sparql-taxon> " +
        	" FROM genbank: <http://castor.dia.fi.upm.es:2020/sparql-genebank> " +
        	" WHERE" +
        	" {" +
        	" 	<http://bio2rdf.org/iproclass:Q8KKD2> <http://bio2rdf.org/ns/iproclass#xGeneid> ?iproclass.gene ." +
		"	?geneid.gene  <http://bio2rdf.org/ns/bio2rdf#xTaxon> ?geneid.taxon . " +
		"	OPTIONAL { + "
                "             ?taxon.taxon <http://bio2rdf.org/ontology/bio2rdf:xGI> ?taxon.x . " +
        	" 	      ?genbank.x  <http://bio2rdf.org/ontology/ncbi:featureID> ?genbank.genBank . } " +
                " }" +
        	"}";
speaker: SYSTEM
